titleStmt.title: His majesties reasons against the pretended iurisdiction of the high Court of Iustice which he intended to deliver in vvrititing [sic] on Munday Ianuary 22. 1648. Faithfully transcribed out of the originall copie under the kings own hand.
titleStmt.author: Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

titleStmt.title: His majesties reasons against the pretended iurisdiction of the high Court of Iustice which he intended to deliver in vvrititing [sic] on Munday Ianuary 22. 1648. Faithfully transcribed out of the originall copie under the kings own hand.
titleStmt.author: Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication suggested by Wing.

His protest against the legality of the Court has not been answered. No impeachment lies against the King in law. The people have not been consulted. The majority of the Commons has been excluded. To try him for anything before the Treaty of Newport is a breach of public faith -- Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
